snippet: This week we match Lewis Carroll's "Jabberwocky" with "O Frabjous Day!," a 2007 review of a children's book by Christopher Myers that presents the famous poem, which the reviewer calls the "greatest nonsense verse in the English-speaking world," in...
abstract: This week we match Lewis Carroll's "Jabberwocky" with "O Frabjous Day!," a 2007 review of a children's book by Christopher Myers that presents the famous poem, which the reviewer calls the "greatest nonsense verse in the English-speaking world," in the context of a basketball face-off.
